articles.title: U.S. DOJ files proposed consent decree to resolve claims against LivCor
articles.mainIdea: U.S. DOJ files proposed consent decree to resolve claims against LivCor
articles.summary: TipRanks: U.S. DOJ files proposed consent decree to resolve claims against LivCor. The Justice Department’s, DOJ, Antitrust Division filed a proposed consent decree to resolve the United States’ claims against LivCor, a Blackstone (BX) portfolio company, as part of its ongoing enforcement action in the Middle District of North Carolina against algorithmic coordination and other anticompetitive practices in rental markets across the country. If approved by the court, the proposed consent decree would require LivCor to: Refrain from using any anticompetitive algorithm that gener Related tickers mentioned: BX.

articles.title: AIG Valuation Check After 14% Monthly Gain and 5-Year Shareholder Returns Doubling
articles.mainIdea: AIG Valuation Check After 14% Monthly Gain and 5-Year Shareholder Returns Doubling
articles.summary: Simply Wall St.: AIG Valuation Check After 14% Monthly Gain and 5-Year Shareholder Returns Doubling. American International Group (AIG) has been quietly rewarding patient shareholders, with the stock climbing about 14% over the past month and more than doubling over 5 years, even as growth remains steady rather than explosive. See our latest analysis for American International Group. Zooming out, that 13.99% 1 month share price return adds to a solid year to date rise. A 5 year total shareholder return of 161.16% signals durable, improving sentiment as AIG steadily grows earnings. If AIG’s...

articles.title: Has AIG’s 161% Five Year Surge Fully Reflected Its Restructuring Progress?
articles.mainIdea: Has AIG’s 161% Five Year Surge Fully Reflected Its Restructuring Progress?
articles.summary: Simply Wall St.: Has AIG’s 161% Five Year Surge Fully Reflected Its Restructuring Progress?. Wondering if American International Group at around $86 is still a smart buy, or if the easy money has already been made, you are not alone. The stock has climbed 2.4% over the last week, 14.0% over the past month, and is now up 18.6% year to date and 161.2% over five years. This naturally raises the question of whether the current price fully reflects that momentum. Much of this strength has been underpinned by a multi year restructuring effort and balance sheet cleanup that has helped AIG...
